Description: Rim, body and handle sherd (mended from six fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) pottery lotus bowl; brown clay with white inclusions; interior: dark brown slip, three painted bands of white-red-white stripes; reserved tondo with painted lines; exterior: creamy slip, dark brown paint; pendent lotus flower placed between two large dots and two sets of verticals; broad band below; dark brown stripe painted at top of lip; inscription cut in decorated zone.
Curator's comments: See also D. M. Bailey 1970: 'Some Fresh Naukratis Joins', BSA, 65, p. 3, no. 1, pl. 1.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, nos 293, 298)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 256, no. 3)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 668, no. 259)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.586)
